spans.text: Fairy tales always help readers understand society and life.
Although Tomori's story is not yet finished, she has vaguely felt the content that the story wants to express.
(When the cicada realizes that its life is coming to an end, it puts all its energy into preparing to realize its wish.)
(What is my wish? The song in front of me, or...?)
She vaguely had an answer in her heart.
Can I also create a good ending?

She stretched and felt a rare burst of energy. She had a dreamless night last night. She regained the satisfying sleep she had after listening to fairy tales as a child, and the dark circles under her eyes in the glass mirror seemed to be a little lighter.
Let's just give it a try.
If possible, she would rather forget what she did yesterday.
"When the countdown reaches zero...my heartbeat should also become zero times per second."
She opened her phone. The several forum posts about "death countdowns" that Tomori forwarded to her late at night were still lying in the dialog box, cruelly reminding her—
"Before that...I don't want to see Taki for the time being."
Tomori's words that she didn't want to see her were false.
But the pain of Tomori that it brought, and the promise that exceeded the length of "a lifetime"...
She clicked on one of them, her vision almost unable to focus on the content on the screen.

In front of the precarious reality in the glass mirror, she vaguely conceived today's itinerary. No matter how bad her condition is, she has to continue. The deadline has not really been pushed back a day as she said.
